N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7835.1 - Scope and intent

State Regulations
(a) The
provisions of this Part apply to the disclosure of heating and/or cooling
expenses in connection with a residential structure which is offered for sale
or rental on or after January 1, 1981, in accordance with article 17 of the

Energy Law, the "Truth in Heating" act. (b) The intent of this Part is to encourage
sellers and lessors of residential structures whose tenants pay directly for
heating and/or cooling expenses to make their premises more energy-efficient, and to provide historical heating and/or cooling expense information to
prospective purchasers and lessees so that they may more accurately calculate
or estimate future energy costs and the need for energy conservation measures
prior to purchase or lease of such residences. Notes
